hanzi-su-wiki:
三

Значения

Три

Мнемоника


Повёрнутая римская цифра 3. Комбинация из трёх черт символизирует небо, Землю и человека между ними.

Произношение и тон

sān
📢 Тройка лошадей везёт сан(ь)и.

♫ Сани оставляют прямые колеи (ровный 1-й тон).

Варианты

参, 參, 叁, 叄

purpleculture_info:
Antonyms: 一
Ideographic: Three parallel lines; compare 一 (one) and 二 (two)
purpleculture_examples:
三个代表 [ sān gè dài biǎo ]: the Three Represents enunciated by Jiang Zemin 江泽民 as the duty of the Chinese Communist party in 2001, namely: to represent productivity of an advanced society, forward progress of advanced culture and the fundamental interests of the people
三农 [ sān nóng ]: see 三农问题
三角 [ sān jiǎo ]: triangle
三通 [ sān tōng ]: T-joint; T-piece; T-pipe; three links
三国 [ sān guó ]: Three Kingdoms period (220-280) in Chinese history; several Three Kingdoms periods in Korean history, esp. from 1st century AD to unification under Silla 新罗 in 658
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 一 [ yī ] one; a, an; alone
    • 二 [ èr ] two; twice
heisig_chinese_memo: Three horizontal strokes representing the number three. Or think of it as one plus two equals three.
heisig_story: And like the Roman numeral III, which triples the numeral I, the kanji for three simply triples the single horizontal stroke. In writing it, think of "1 + 2 = 3" (一 + 二 = 三) in order to keep the middle stroke shorter.
koohiiStory2: THREE measurements define the female shape: BUST, WAIST, and HIPS. Waist is the smallest, and for most women the HIPS are wider than the chest.
jp_example_words:
三味線(さみせん): three-stringed Japanese guitar, shamisen
三(み): (num) three
三日月(みかずき): new moon, crescent moon
再三(さいさん): again and again, repeatedly
三角(さんかく): triangle, triangular
三日月(みかづき): new moon, crescent moon
三日(みっか): three days, the third day (of the month)
三(さん): three
三つ(みっつ): three
jp_readingExamples: 三 (み), 三つ (み.つ), 三つ (みっ.つ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: This kanji is made up of the ground radical (which also happens to be the kanji for "one") and the radical for two. Combine one and two together and what do you get? Three!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: This one should be pretty self explanatory! Even easier, you can look at this kanji and see it has three straight lines. You know what one looks like. You know what two looks like. So... this is three!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Three is the number of chances you get with Santa-san (さん). He has a list, and when you get to three "naughty things" lines, that's it. You're on Santa-san's three strikes and you're out list.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Santa-san sitting at his desk at the North Pole, eating cookies, and marking one, two, then finally three lines next to names. Once the third line appears, the kid doesn't get presents anymore.
Ru_trainchinese: sān: (число) три, 3; третий; больше двух, несколько
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Three horizontal strokes representing the number three. Or think of it as one plus two equals three.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Before the invention of Hanzi (Chinese characters), the Chinese used knots (rope) or simple symbols. As the society became more complex, the need for more efficient ways for communication were needed. Hanzi (Chinese characters) were developed to meet such needs. What did the early writers think to express number “one”? As children use their fingers to count, the ancient people used twigs and sticks to express numbers and to count. A twig (一, yi, one), two twigs (二, er, two), three twings (三, san, three) four twigs (四, si=ssu, four) became the letters from 1 to 4. Branches used for telling fortunes or for calculation (14th-19th century) However, “one” 一 (yi, one) does not simply mean the number one in the numerical sense. In AD 100, a Chinese scholar wrote a book “Shuo Wen Jie Zi” which provides many explanations behind Hanzi. Among over 9,000 Hanzi characters in this book, the “one (一)” is explained first as followed: “In the beginning there was only One Way, and this Way divided earth from heaven and made everything.” As we can see, “one” is not just a simple tree twig. It is also philosophically understood as the “sole principle” from which heaven, earth and living things originate d from.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The number " three " is marked with three horizontal lines. The numbers " one " to " four " are all counted horizontally, and Xu Zhongshu thinks horizontal portraits count.

" Three " represents the number of words in addition to " three ", but also often represent the majority, such as " and " like a hand, draw only three fingers on behalf of all the fingers. " Rain " only draws three points of rain, " fruit " only draws three fruits, and " Peng " only draws three strokes like drums (Zhang Bingquan).

Oracle indicates the cardinal number (the number of things), "Collection" 10109: "three cows". Zhongzha Qigui Ding: "Bei Sanpeng", " Pei " is ancient currency, ten shells is a penny, "Pei Sanpeng" means thirty shells. It also indicates the ordinal number, the third, "Collection" 37494: "Only (in) March". Song Ding: "Yu (Only) Three Years and Five Months".

"Three armies" refers to the upper army, the middle army, and the lower army. The uncle bell: "The surviving woman (ru) is governed by our army." "Three things" refers to the officials in the court (Bai Chuanjing). As opposed to "Sifang", ordering Fangyi: "The king ordered Zhou Gongzi to protect Yin and three things and four directions." It means that the king ordered Zhou Gongzi to govern the court officials and Sifang. One said that "three things" means that there are three 𤔲 (Siweizhi), and Fang Yi: "Participate in 𤔲: 𤔲土 (apprentice), 𤔲 horse, 𤔲 work (empty)." See " 𤔲 ". "Three longevity" refers to longevity, middle longevity, and low longevity. It refers to longevity in general, and "three longevity" means to pray for longevity and virtue. "Health Sutra": "The upper life is one hundred and twenty, the middle life is one hundred years, and the next life is eighty." "Poetry. Lu Song. "Yigong": "Three-shou-shou is a friend", which means that you can be equal to the third-shou (Qu Wanli).

"Said Wen": "Three, the way of heaven, earth and man. Count from three. All three belongings are from three. Yi, ancient prose three follow Yi."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jin inscriptions are marked with the number " three " with three horizontal lines.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文以三橫標示數目字「三」。數字「一」至「四」皆積橫為數，徐中舒認為橫畫象算籌。

　　「三」除了表示數目字「三」外，還常常表示多數，如「又」象手形，只畫出三隻手指，代表全部手指。「雨」只畫出三點雨水，「果」只畫出三個果實，「彭」象鼓聲的筆畫只有三撇等(張秉權)。

　　甲骨文表示基數(事物的個數)，《合集》10109：「三牛」。中乍且癸鼎：「貝三朋」，「貝」是古代的貨幣，十貝為一朋，「貝三朋」表示三十貝。又表示序數，即第三，《合集》37494：「才(在)三月」。頌鼎：「隹(唯)三年五月」。

　　「三軍」指上軍、中軍、下軍，叔尸鐘：「余命女(汝)政于朕三軍」。「三事」指在朝之官(白川靜)，與「四方」相對，令方彝：「王令周公子明保尹三事四方」，表示王命令周公子明保治理朝廷官員和四方。一說「三事」即三有𤔲(斯維至)，盠方彝：「參有𤔲：𤔲土(徒)、𤔲馬、𤔲工(空)。」參見「𤔲」。「三壽」指上壽、中壽、下壽，泛指長壽，㠱仲壺：「匄三壽懿德萬年」，表示祈求萬年長壽、美德。《養生經》：「上壽百二十，中壽百年，下壽八十。」《詩．魯頌．閟宮》：「三壽作朋」，表示可與三壽之人相齊等(屈萬里)。

　　《說文》：「三，天地人之道也。从三數。凡三之屬皆从三。弎，古文三从弋。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文以三橫標示數目字「三」。

甲金文以三橫標示數目字「 三 」。數字「 一 」至「 四 」皆積橫為數，徐中舒認為橫畫象算籌。 「 三 」除了表示數目字「 三 」外，還常常表示多數，如「 又 」象手形，只畫出三隻手指，代表全部手指。「 雨 」只畫出三點雨水，「 果 」只畫出三個果實，「 彭 」象鼓聲的筆畫只有三撇等(張秉權)。 甲骨文表示基數(事物的個數)，《合集》10109：「三牛」。中乍且癸鼎：「貝三朋」，「 貝 」是古代的貨幣，十貝為一朋，「貝三朋」表示三十貝。又表示序數，即第三，《合集》37494：「才(在)三月」。頌鼎：「隹(唯)三年五月」。 「三軍」指上軍、中軍、下軍，叔尸鐘：「余命女(汝)政于朕三軍」。「三事」指在朝之官(白川靜)，與「四方」相對，令方彝：「王令周公子明保尹三事四方」，表示王命令周公子明保治理朝廷官員和四方。一說「三事」即三有𤔲(斯維至)，盠方彝：「參有𤔲：𤔲土(徒)、𤔲馬、𤔲工(空)。」參見「 𤔲 」。「三壽」指上壽、中壽、下壽，泛指長壽，㠱仲壺：「匄三壽懿德萬年」，表示祈求萬年長壽、美德。《養生經》：「上壽百二十，中壽百年，下壽八十。」《詩．魯頌．閟宮》：「三壽作朋」，表示可與三壽之人相齊等(屈萬里)。 《說文》：「三，天地人之道也。从三數。凡三之屬皆从三。弎，古文三从弋。」
Elaboration: The number " three" is marked with three horizontal lines. The numbers " one" to " four" are all counted horizontally, and Xu Zhongshu thinks horizontal portraits count. " Three" represents the number of words in addition to " three", but also often represent the majority, such as " and" like a hand, draw only three fingers on behalf of all the fingers. " Rain" only draws three points of rain, " fruit" only draws three fruits, and " Peng" only draws three strokes like drums (Zhang Bingquan). Oracle indicates the cardinal number (the number of things), "Collection" 10109: "three cows". Zhongzha Qigui Ding: "Bei Sanpeng", " Pei" is ancient currency, ten shells is a penny, "Pei Sanpeng" means thirty shells. It also indicates the ordinal number, the third, "Collection" 37494: "Only (in) March". Song Ding: "Yu (Only) Three Years and Five Months". "Three armies" refers to the upper army, the middle army, and the lower army. The uncle bell: "The surviving woman (ru) is governed by our army." "Three things" refers to the officials in the court (Bai Chuanjing). As opposed to "Sifang", ordering Fangyi: "The king ordered Zhou Gongzi to protect Yin and three things and four directions." It means that the king ordered Zhou Gongzi to govern the court officials and Sifang. One said that "three things" means that there are three 𤔲 (Siweizhi), and Fang Yi: "Participate in 𤔲: 𤔲土 (apprentice), 𤔲 horse, 𤔲 work (empty)." See " 𤔲". "Three longevity" refers to longevity, middle longevity, and low longevity. It refers to longevity in general, and "three longevity" means to pray for longevity and virtue. "Health Sutra": "The upper life is one hundred and twenty, the middle life is one hundred years, and the next life is eighty." "Poetry. Lu Song. "Yigong": "Three-shou-shou is a friend", which means that you can be equal to the third-shou (Qu Wanli). "Said Wen": "Three, the way of heaven, earth and man. Count from three. All three belongings are from three. Yi, ancient prose three follow Yi."

sān
数名，二加一（在钞票和单据上常用大写“叁”代）：三维空间。三部曲。三国（中国朝代名）。
表示多次或多数：三思而行。三缄其口。

：数名，二加一得之数；表示多次或多数。

three
Basic explanation of words
three
sān
Several names, two plus one (the capitalized "three" generation is often used on banknotes and receipts): three-dimensional space. Trilogy. Three Kingdoms (names of Chinese dynasties).
Indicates multiple or majority: think twice. Be silent.
three
Chinese dictionary definition of words
three

three

three
Name meaning
：Several names, the number of two plus one; indicates multiple or majority.
sān
1) три, 3, третий
三维空间 трехмерное пространство
三国 Троецарствие
三年级 третий курс (класс)
2) многочисленный; несколько раз, много; во много раз; хорошенько, снова и снова
再三 снова и снова, неоднократно
三思而行 действовать, заранее всё хорошенько (трижды) обдумав
3) частое сокращение трёх "основных": 天-地-人, 天-地-气, 君-父-师, 三星, 三皇, 三王

三

Значения

Три

Мнемоника


Повёрнутая римская цифра 3. Комбинация из трёх черт символизирует небо, Землю и человека между ними.

Произношение и тон

sān
📢 Тройка лошадей везёт сан(ь)и.

♫ Сани оставляют прямые колеи (ровный 1-й тон).

Варианты

参, 參, 叁, 叄

Radicals: 一, 二  (ground, two)
Meaning Mnemonic
This kanji is made up of the ground radical (which also happens to be the kanji for "one") and the radical for two. Combine one and two together and what do you get? Three!
This one should be pretty self explanatory! Even easier, you can look at this kanji and see it has three straight lines. You know what one looks like. You know what two looks like. So... this is three!
Reading Mnemonic
Three is the number of chances you get with Santa-san (さん). He has a list, and when you get to three "naughty things" lines, that's it. You're on Santa-san's three strikes and you're out list.
Picture Santa-san sitting at his desk at the North Pole, eating cookies, and marking one, two, then finally three lines next to names. Once the third line appears, the kid doesn't get presents anymore.

Examples: 三 (み), 三つ (み.つ), 三つ (みっ.つ)
一 (один), 二 (два)
